oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ticket to annual Christmas dance, 1961 Dec. 22
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ticket to an annual Christmas Dance, held on Friday, December 22, 1961 at the Maxwell House Hotel Ballroom. Larry Womack’s Orchestra provided the music. Cost was $1.50 a couple or $1.00 stag. The organization hosting the dance is unidentified. A handwritten notation on the back of the ticket indicates it was the last dance held at the ballroom before the catastrophic fire of Dec. 25, 1961, which destroyed the hotel. Forms part of the Hotels and Lodgings Ephemera Subject Files. 1 ticket ; b&w ; 2.25 x 3.75 in.

Although the organization hosting the dance is unidentified on this ticket, the occasion may have been the Christmas formal of Vanderbilt’s Delta Kappa Epsilon fraternity, which was held a few days prior to the fire. A photograph of these men appears in the May 2007 issue of NFocus magazine. The Maxwell House Hotel was a long-established institution in Nashville, located at Fourth Avenue North and Church Street. It was destroyed by fire during the overnight hours of Christmas night, Dec. 25, 1961.
